details.description: Tax and reporting rules for employers covering the cost of bank charges
details.alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for bank charges
details.body:
As an employer, reimbursing or paying your employeesâ€™ bank charges counts as earnings.

You will need to:

  • add the payments to your employees’ other earnings
  • deduct and pay PAYE tax and Class 1 National Insurance through payroll

What’s exempt

If your employees’ bank charges are your fault (eg because you paid their wages late) and you pay or reimburse them, this doesn’t count as earnings.

You won’t need report anything to HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) or pay any tax or National Insurance.

Technical guidance

The following guides contain more detailed information:

  • employment income: bank charges
  • Class 1 National Insurance: bank charges
